comments.body: This will be an issue once we start to add Windows coverage support. We won't be able to have a common temp path to share between the controller and the remote.
Yes, this is a short-term solution to deal with the fact that we can't set different values per host.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +841,845 @@    # common temporary directory path that will be valid on both the controller and the remote
    # it must be common because it will be referenced in environment variables that are shared across multiple hosts
    common_temp_path = '/tmp/ansible-test-%s' % ''.join(random.choice(string.ascii_letters + string.digits) for _ in range(8))

    setup_common_temp_dir(args, common_temp_path)

comments.body: How large are these files? Should we just implement the remote get in this PR for when controller and remote is split?

These coverage files are separate from what will eventually be the remote coverage files. We're using a common temp directory to accommodate tests which drop privileges and would thus be unable to write coverage files directly into our source tree.
